Key Match Events: Sri Lanka defeated India by 110 runs in the third ODI match at Colombo
Chasing a target of 249 runs, India were ALL OUT in 138 runs in just 26.1 overs
For India, skipper Rohit Sharma scored 35 off 20 balls and Washington Sundar hit 30 off 25 deliveries
For Sri Lanka, Dunith Wellalage picked up 5 wickets, while Maheesh Theekshana and Jeffrey Vandersay took 2 wickets each
Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
India lost 27 wickets to spin is the most by any team in a bilateral ODI series
With the surface in Colombo favouring the slower bowlers, Riyan Parag makes his international debut, primarily as a bowler
Questions are also being asked about Virat Kohli, who has scored just 38 runs in the two matches so far
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka said, 'I am happy captain right now. The team did all things right throughout the series'

Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said, 'I don't think it is a concern. But it is something we have to look at individually and as a game plan. It is a joke. When you are playing for India there is never going to be complacency'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's Avishka Fernando scored 96 off 102 balls, while Kusal Mendis (59) and Pathum Nissanka (45) contributed with their bat
Riyan Parag took three wickets, while Mohammed Siraj, Axar Patel, Washington Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav clinched one wicket each
Sri Lanka posted a total of 248 off 7 wickets in 50 overs on 7 August
India need 249 runs to win the match
Sri Lanka's Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion
Asitha Fernando was awarded the player of the match, while Dunith Wellalage won the player of the series
